chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Steve M Hansen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program.
Sentence Credit of 23 days was granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to court costs and DNA surcharge, paid in full.  Refund balance of bail to poster.

Sentencing hearing on April 2, 2018 at 11:15 am.
Jury Instructions and Instruction After Verdict is Received

Case called for Day 2 of a 12-Jury Trial at 8:30 a.m.
Kristi J Gordon and Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Steve M Hansen in court with attorney Mark D. Richards.
Court has a colloquy with the defendant about his right to testify and Natalie Wisco.
Jurors enter the courtroom at 8:36 a.m.  
Defense calls Steven Hansen sworn and testified.  Cross-examination by the State.
Re-direct by Attorney Richards.  Exhibits 14 and 15 offered and received.
Defense calls Robert Namowicz sworn and testified.
Defense Exhibits 19, 20, and 21 marked. Cross-examination by the State.
Court takes a break at 10:07 a.m.  Court reconvenes at 10:18 a.m.
Jurors enter the courtroom.  Re-direct by Attorney Richards. Re-cross by the State.
Exhibits 19, 20, and 21 are offered and received.  Defense rests.  State has no rebuttal witness.
Testimony is closed.  State makes closing arguments.  Defense makes closing arguments.
Court reads jury instructions.  Clerk swears in the Bailiff.
Court announces the alternate juror, Glen R.
Jurors exit the courtroom to deliberate at 11:17 a.m.
Jurors reached a verdict at 1:20 p.m.
Court reconvenes at 1:33 p.m.  Jurors enter the courtroom.
Foreperson reads the verdict.  Attorney Richards wishes to have the jury polled.
State moves for Judgment on the Verdict.  Court enters Judgment on the Verdict.
Defendant is remanded into custody to the Sheriff's Dept. from the courtroom.
Court sets sentencing date for 4-2-18 at 11:15 a.m.
Preliminary Jury Instructions
Voir Dire List
Random Listing Report - Voir Dire
Juror's Selectrion and Peremptory Challenges

Case called for Day 1 of 12-Person Jury Trial at 8:15 a.m.
Michael Thurston and Kristi Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Steve M Hansen in court with attorneys Mark D. Richards and Natalie Wisco.
Court discusses preliminary jury instructions and cell phone definition with the Attorneys.
Court addresses defendant's motion regarding jury instruction 140.
Court calls for the jurors at 8:45 a.m.
Jurors enter the courtroom at 9:04 a.m.  Clerk swears in the jurors for voir dire.  Court conducts voir dire.
State conducts voir dire.  Defense conducts voir dire.  Counsel exercise strikes.  Jurors selected to try the issues.
Clerk swears in the jurors to try the issues.  Court reads preliminary jury instructions to the jurors.
Court takes a break at 10:40 a.m.  Court reconvenes at 10:54 a.m.
Attorney Richards requests that the witnesses be excluded.  Court grants.  Jurors enter the courtroom.
Opening statements made by the State.  Opening statements made by the Defense.
State calls Detective Michael Carpenter sworn and testified.
State's Exhibits 1-16 marked.  Jurors excused for lunch at 12:15.
Court breaks at 12:18 p.m.
Court reconvenes the trial at 2:30 p.m.  Same appearances.  Jurors enter the courtroom.
State's exhibit 17 marked.
Direct examination of Detective Carpenter continues.
States Exhibits 1-11 and 13 offered and received.
Cross-examination by Attorney Richards.
Defense Exhibit 18 marked.  Court takes a break at 3:47 p.m.
Jurors are excused.  Court reconvenes at 3:57 p.m.  Same appearances.  Jurors enter the courtroom
Re-direct by the State.  Re-cross by Attorney Richards.  Exhibit 18 is offered and received.
State calls Detective Brad Becker sworn and testified.  Cross-examination by Attorney Richards.
Exhibit 17 and 18 offered and received.  State rests.  Jurors are excused for the day.
Attorney Richard makes a motion for a directive verdict.  State requests that the motion be denied.
Court denies the motion.
Court has a discussion with the Jury Instructions and Special Verdict forms.  Court breaks for the day at 4:40 p.m.
Proposed Non-Pattern Jury Instruction filed by ADA Thurston 3/12/18.

Attorney Natalie Wisco appearing by phone.   Defendant Steve M Hansen did not appear.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls the matter as to the request for access to juror qualifications by Attorney Wisco.
Attorney Thurston makes statements to the court.  Attorney Wisco makes statements to the court.
The court denies the request for reasons as stated on the record.
Letter from Attorney Wisco and Attorney Richards, dated 3-9-18, requesting access to information from potential jurors' qualifying questionnaires.

Defendant Steve M Hansen in court with attorney Mark D. Richards.  Michael Thurston and Kristi Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State indicates that the trial is going.  Court will address the Motions in Limine filed by the State.  Defense filed jury instructions and court will review.  Court will discuss before the jurors enter the courtroom next Tuesday.

Motion to Modify Jury Instruction 140 - Burden of Proof, filed by defense counsel Richards 3/7/18.

Defendant Steve M Hansen in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Benedict requests all witnesses be sequested.
